qas.question: What is Spielberg's most profitable movie?
What is Tim Burton's most profitable movie?

context: After two forays into more serious dramatic films, Spielberg then directed the third Indiana Jones film, <a0_0><b5_0>1989<b5_0/><a0_0/>'s <a1_0><b7_0><b8_0>Indiana Jones and the Last Crusade<b8_0/><b7_0/><a1_0/>. Once again teaming up with Lucas and Ford, Spielberg also cast actor <a2_0><b6_0>Sean Connery<b6_0/><a2_0/> in a supporting role as Indy's father. The film earned generally positive reviews and was another box office success, becoming the highest grossing film worldwide that year; its total box office receipts even topped those of <a3_0>Tim Burton<a3_0/>'s much-anticipated film <b9_0>Batman<b9_0/>, which had been the bigger hit domestically. Also in 1989, he re-united with actor Richard Dreyfuss for the romantic comedy-drama Always, about <a4_0>a daredevil pilot who extinguishes forest fires<a4_0/>. Spielberg's first romantic film, Always was only a moderate success and had mixed reviews.
